results.title: Jacobsen v. Katzer
results.court: U.S. Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit
results.holding: Open source licenses are enforceable copyright licenses
results.significance: Established that GPL and similar licenses have legal teeth

results.title: Oracle America, Inc. v. Google Inc.
results.holding: Fair use applies to APIs; Google's use of Java APIs was transformative
results.significance: Major win for software interoperability and fair use

results.title: Feist Publications, Inc. v. Rural Telephone Service Co.
results.holding: Facts are not copyrightable; compilations need originality

results.title: Golan v. Holder
results.holding: Congress can restore copyright to public domain works

results.title: Community for Creative Non-Violence v. Reid
results.holding: Work-for-hire doctrine explained; contractor vs employee test

results.title: MAI Systems Corp. v. Peak Computer, Inc.
results.court: U.S. Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit
results.holding: Loading software into RAM creates a copy under Copyright Act
results.significance: Defined what constitutes copying in digital context

results.title: ProCD, Inc. v. Zeidenberg
results.court: U.S. Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit

results.title: Apple Computer, Inc. v. Franklin Computer Corp.
results.court: U.S. Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit
results.holding: Software is copyrightable as literary work

results.title: 17 U.S.C. § 102 - Subject matter of copyright
results.summary: Copyright protection subsists in original works of authorship

results.title: 17 U.S.C. § 106 - Exclusive rights in copyrighted works
results.summary: Copyright owner has exclusive rights to reproduce, distribute, etc.
results.relevance: Defines what rights you have in your code

results.title: 17 U.S.C. § 107 - Fair use
results.summary: Fair use is not infringement under certain conditions

results.title: 17 U.S.C. § 512 - DMCA safe harbor
results.summary: Limits liability for online service providers

results.title: 15 U.S.C. § 1125(a) - False designation of origin (Lanham Act)
results.summary: Protects against trademark infringement and false advertising
results.relevance: Use this against copycats misrepresenting origin

results.title: 18 U.S.C. § 1030 - Computer Fraud and Abuse Act (CFAA)
35 U.S.C. § 101 - Inventions patentable
California Anti-SLAPP statute (Cal. Code Civ. Proc. § 425.16)
results.summary: Protects against meritless lawsuits targeting free speech

results.title: Uniform Trade Secrets Act (UTSA)
results.relevance: Protects non-public aspects of your work

results.title: Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF) - Coders' Rights Project
Software Freedom Law Center
GNU GPL Violations - FSF Compliance Lab
Creative Commons Legal Database
Public Knowledge - Tech Policy
